title: Woman who lived with partner’s rotting corpse masked smell with scented candles
text:

A woman lived with her boyfriend's rotting body for up to three weeks and tried to cover up the smell using scented candles.

Angela Irwin, 54, continued to live with lover Robin McMaster's dead body in the flat they shared together in Ballymena, Northern Ireland, after he died aged 40.

The 54-year-old had tried to mask the foul smell with scented candles, Antrim Crown Court heard.

Suspicions were raised when a plumber quizzed Irwin about a bad smell when he was doing repairs at their home.

McMaster's brother then went to the flat after becoming concerned about his safety on November 22.

In a statement read out in court, Mr McMaster's mum said her son had been “left like a piece of rotting meat”.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: Photopress Belfast)

When his brother arrived at the flat, he found scented candles burning to mask the rotting order, but Irwin still claimed McMaster had been resting due to his back pain.

His brother then barged past her into the flat, and found McMaster’s body “severely decomposed” in the bedroom.

The autopsy found his death was "most likely" caused by an overdose of Tramadol and other prescription drugs.

When Mr McMaster's mum checked on her son, Irwin told her he was unwell and gave details of what he had eaten even though he was already dead, the court heard.

(Image: Rotellam1/wikimedia)

Mr McMaster's mother said: "She kept my son lying there like a piece of rotting meat.

"I was unable to touch his hair or tell him goodbye. I am serving a life sentence as a broken mother."

The court heard Mr McMaster's brother now suffers PTSD following the gruesome discovery.

Medical evidence suggested Mr McMaster may have been dead for two to three weeks – and he was last seen on October 13.

Just one day before Mr McMaster’s body was found, Irwin picked up his prescriptions for sleeping tablets and antihistamines.

The court heard he had been suffering from anxiety and depression.

Irwin's defence barrister said she wanted to "convey her unreserved apology and sympathy”.
description: Angela Irwin, 54, lived in a flat with her lover Robin McMaster's dead body lying the bedroom in Ballymena, Northern Ireland
